column3: applying Friston's active inference to a project scenario
introduce non-linear relationships into a project model which affect teams and performance
column8: Real projects are not just made up of task nodes connected by dependency edges. There are regular circles of daily activites, monthly progress review actions etc. There is negative feedback pushing back on attempted initaitives. there are positive reinforcing loops initiated sometimes after the first or second task has been done

column3: Applies Powell's sequential decision making framework to an IT project
Takes a bespoke portfolio prioritisation process logic and processes projects as per that logic
Stakeholder analysis that shows different perspectives to different team members, networked view also
Push out the curve for everyone
An example of the possible market dynamics within the PM services industry through AGI and ASI milestones
A different twist on the sequential decision making in IT projects to cope with ongoing uncertainty- this one is more of a training game
Interactive guide using an ontology-based questionnaire
a wiring diagram for selecting which ai model to use at the moment
A copula is a mathematical function that describes the dependence structure between tasks, separate from each task's individual delay distribution.
